4)
[guoman@sjsu A4]$ cat downloaded_tweets_extend_nolf2.tsv |awk -F'\t' '$4!=""'|cut -f 4|tr "[:upper:]" "[:lower:]"| sed 's/"//g'|tr ',' '\n'|sort|uniq -c|sort -n|awk '{print $2}'|tail -n 30 > assignment2.txt
[guoman@sjsu A4]$ grep retweeted downloaded_tweets_extend_nolf2.tsv|cut -f 4|sed '/^[[:blank:]]*$/d'|tr "[:upper:]" "[:lower:]"|sed 's/"//g'|sort|uniq -c|sort -n|awk '{print $2}'|tail -30 >assignment4.txt

6)
 I pick a user 2885493519 to generate a retweet cluster and find out the hashtags related are not popular. User 2885493519 is neither an expert nor an influencer.

I pick a user 1108565574 to generate a  replied_to cluster and find out the hashtag "auspol"  related is very popular and apprear a lot in the dataset. I think user 1108565574 is an expert on this topic. 
[guoman@sjsu A4]$ exit
